page.title: 20GERALD HOWARTH M.P.2.
page.content: An interview with Gerald Howarth continued from page 19. After sorting out the post he takes part in a meeting where a committee examine pieces of legislation.This committee goes on from 10.30a.m to 12.00 midday.At 2.30p.m. Parliament meets.The debate can go on there until 10.30p.m. At the weekends Gerald Howarth has meetings.On Saturdays,twice a month he holds a surgery where people come and explain their problems. Gerald Howarth does not think that the people of Burntwood have many problems apart from unemployment and the problems caused in providing new facilities if the area expands. He considers that the problems in Burntwood are different from a large town.
